alert.note: Alert for Martin (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 06 at 4:49PM EDT until May 06 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall is expected. * WHERE...Portions of northeast Kentucky and southeast Kentucky, including the following counties, in northeast Kentucky, Johnson and Martin. In southeast Kentucky, Breathitt, Floyd, Knott, Magoffin and Pike. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 448 PM EDT, the public reported heavy rain and flooding in the Middle and Abbots Creek areas due to thunderstorms. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Up to 2.5 inches of rain have fallen. Additional showers and thunderstorms are expected through the evening and could worsen ongoing flooding. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Paintsville, Prestonsburg, Coal Run Village, Martin, Forest Hills, Warfield, Allen, Emma, Alvin, Dwale, Corn Fork Hollow, Lancer, Allen City, Beaver Junction, Banner, Dicks Creek, Arkansas, Ivel, Endicott and Cliff. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
